job_description:
At Morson Talent, we have been supporting both clients and talent in power generation (nuclear, wind and solar), power transmission, marine and shipbuilding, aerospace and defense, rail, construction and advanced manufacturing. Since 1981, technical staffing company Morson Talent has had a presence in the US and Canadian markets, dedicated to finding top talent.
Location: Tiverton, on-site
Hourly Rate: $70 - $80/hour
Duration: 1 Year (can be extended annually)

Job description
Key Responsibilities:
System Design: Design electrical systems for industrial processes, machinery, and control systems.
Develop detailed engineering drawings, schematics, and diagrams.
Specify and select appropriate electrical components and instrumentation.
Instrumentation and Control: Specify, install, and calibrate various instruments such as sensors, transmitters, controllers, and actuators.
Develop and program control systems using PLCs (Programmable Logic Controllers) and DCS (Distributed Control Systems).
Implement safety systems and emergency shutdown systems.
Electrical Maintenance: Perform regular inspections and maintenance of electrical systems to ensure optimal performance.
Troubleshoot and diagnose electrical and control system issues, and implement corrective actions.
Develop and maintain maintenance schedules and procedures.
Compliance and Regulations: Ensure that all electrical and instrumentation systems comply with relevant safety and industry standards.
Keep up-to-date with local and national electrical codes and regulations.
Project Management: Manage projects from conception to completion, including budgeting and timeline management.
Coordinate with other engineering disciplines, contractors, and stakeholders to ensure project success.
Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate records, documentation, and reports related to electrical and instrumentation systems.
Prepare technical reports, specifications, and manuals.
Training and Support: Provide training and support to operations and maintenance teams on the proper use and troubleshooting of electrical and control systems.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for system improvements, energy efficiency enhancements, and cost-saving measures.
Stay current with emerging technologies and best practices in the field.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field. A Master's degree may be preferred for advanced roles.
Professional Engineer (PE) license.
Strong knowledge of electrical and electronic systems, control systems, and instrumentation technology.
Proficiency in AutoCAD, PLC programming, and relevant software tools.
Knowledge of safety standards and regulations, such as NFPA, NEC, and ISA.
Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Project management experience is beneficial.
Previous fuel handling experience is an asset.
